TopicTitle: So I started a new campaign, reload disabled, permadeath, dangers everywhere

Articles.Content:
I decided this was a good challenge, disabled reload, any kerbal that dies in misson stays death. Starting out 3 of my kerbals died already, one never even went to space! (he suffered a collition in a jet powered rover near KSP), now I have enough tech to go unmanned mostly.

I can't really test the mission before hand so it's been harddddd. So far I landed a manned mission on Mun and Minmus, no casualties. Next step: Duna unmanned (AND GLORY)
Seems neat! Just as a note, I think this might belong in mission reports, but I'm looking forward to seeing how this plays out!

1 hour ago, Fierce Wolf said:

I can't really test the mission before hand so it's been harddddd.

Without breaking realism/immersion, you could create a second save, sandbox or career with reverts/saves enabled, and use that as your 'simulation' environment. You won't be able to replay the exact same missions, but it does give you an opportunty to do some R&D *before* risking your kerbals to a new untested craft.

I feel you. Doing a permadeath, no reverts career mode run myself, except I also have unmanned-before-manned, no extra ground-stations, and various other difficulty tweaks. I'll tell you, I had to restart probably 10-15 times before I got to a place where a single mistake doesn't wipe out all of my progress. Even with all of my restarts, I have killed Jeb and Bob already after their capsule rolled down a mountain and exploded after a long Mun mission. So, again, I really feel ya there.

Still no Duna mission, I tried to gain some funds rescuing parts landed on the Mun, with hillarious results.

1st attempt) I forgot to put reaction wheels on the rover, quickly eated it's monoprop reserves, spinned out of control and lithobreaked with passion.

2nd attempt) Clawed the 1 ton thingy on Mun, started the engines, but alas, it was too heavy, spinned and landed EXACTLY rescued part first, exploding. (and perma failed the mission)

3rd attempt on a part in orbit) Clawed it, lowered my orbit but not enough, burned to nothingness in Kerbin's atmo (MISSION FAILED)

 

I will try a fly by Eve next in preparation for Duna, which will obviously fail, so I will send 2
I sent 2 crafts, one as a relay to Eve, another to complete a fly by Eve mission, both SUCCESS! Damn I'm good (?) hahaha

My mission to Gilly was a complete dissaster. 2 kerbonauts died, including Bill. Rest in peaces guys.

 

PD: Who the hell crashes in gilly? Me apparently!

On 4/8/2022 at 7:50 AM, Fierce Wolf said:

lithobreaked with passion

I'm stealing this phrase. 

Enjoyed reading your thread and play KSP in a similar fashion most of the time. You aren't asking, but thought I'd mention that maybe a mod or three might make it less of a carnage-fest and maybe even more fun. 

  • KRASH - Simulations so you can test things but there are still costs for the simulations so it isn't "free". This way you can keep your no-revert high-risk play style.
  • Any Life Support mod - I prefer TAC, but have played with probably all of them at one point. This makes it so you need to bring along supplies and have to plan for how long a mission will be so you bring enough supplies
  • A probe-before-crew tech-tree altering mod - There are several, but I'm currently using the Probes Before Crew mod with good success so far
